headline: Why Micron (MU) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of memory chips maker Micron (NYSE:MU) fell 5.3% in the morning session after peer, SK Hynix, raised concerns about potential demand challenges. During the earnings call, CFO Woo-Hyun Kim stated, "2025's memory demand outlook is clouded by inventory adjustments from PC and smartphone OEMs [original equipment manufacturers] as well as strengthened protective trade policies and geopolitical risks." This cautious outlook highlights broader industry pressures that could also affect competitor

headline: Chip stocks fall as Nvidia supplier highlights market uncertainty
summary: Chip stocks including Nvidia and Arm fell Thursday after an Nvidia supplier, SK Hynix, spoke about uncertainty in semiconductor demand in 2025 on its earnings call.
